The Executive Committee in its 200th meeting has approved following guidelines on regulation of Gratuity in NHAI: (_) The employees who have been absorbed in NHAI from Central Government/State Government   Deptt /Autonomous Bodies/PSUs and were paid gratuity by their previous organization will have the option: a To retain the amount of gratuity and in that event their past service will not qualify for gratuity payable by NHAI. b To have the past service (continuous service) counted in previous organization a8 qualifying service for Gratuity under NHAI in which case the Gratuity amount received by them will have to be deposited along with simple interest  of 5% per annum thereon   from the date   of receipt of amount till the date of deposit with NHAI. The right to count previous service a8 qualifying service for gratuity shall not revive until the whole amount has been refunded (i) The option ghall be exercised within a period of gix months from the date of iggue of thege orders for those who had already received their gratuity amount from their previoug organization. If no option is exercised by such employees within the   prescribed time limit,  they will be deemed to have . opted for retention of the benefits already received by them The option once exercised shall be final. (iii) These orders will be applicable only where the transfer of the employees from their  previous  organization waslis with the consent of that   organization, including cage8 where the individual had gecured employment directly on his own volition, provided he had applied through proper channelwith proper permission of the administrative authority concerned. #1 Ri ?T HI NHAL
